additional money or property received to make up the difference in an exchange of business or investment property that is of like kind but unequal in value                                      
                

  Note:
            Under Internal Revenue Code section 1031, no tax liability results from an exchange solely of like-kind property used in a business or trade or held for investment. If the exchange includes boot, however, under section 1245 the boot will be treated as ordinary income.

definition: a type of shoe that covers all of your foot and part of your leg. You often wear boots to protect your feet and legs, for example from snow or rain
a type of shoe that you wear for a particular sport
the covered space at the back of a car, used for carrying things in. The American word is trunk.
feeling very sad, anxious or upset
a situation in which a country’s armed forces are physically present in an area of conflict, as opposed to attacking from the air or surveying the situation remotely
